bibl.title: Letter from T. H. Chittinden to James Carroll, October 9, 1901

div1.p: Chittinden clarifies the species of mosquito that Carroll sent Howard on October 3rd, 1901.

div1.head: Letter from T. H. Chittinden to James Carroll, October 9, 1901
div1.p:
In the absence of Dr. Howard I beg to acknowledge
the receipt of your letter of October 3rd, and the mosquito which you
send. Mr. Coquillett has examined the latter, and finds that it is
a species of Uranotaenia near geometrica Theobald, from Brazil. The
genus Uranotaenia has recently been split off from Aedes. It is a
very interesting species, and quite possibly new, and we should be
very glad to receive more specimens if possible. Dr. Theobald is
getting out a book on the mosquitoes of the world and it will be issued
some time this fall. We are waiting until that appears before we
decide definitely whether any species are new or not, for Theobald
will describe many new forms in this book.
Hoping that you may be able to obtain some more specimens, I am,
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, T.H. Chittinden Acting Entomologist.
Dr. James Carroll,
Headquarters Department of Cuba,
Hospital las Animas,
Havana, Cuba.
bt
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
LITTERA
SCRIPTA
MANET
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, Bureau of
Entomology and Plant Quarantine.
Three Centimeters
